statements)</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="pagebreak997738df-c7eb-47bc-9d1c-c336450223ed" class="pagebreak" style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0">    <tr><td class="hpbhr">&nbsp;</td></tr><tr><td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center">F-5</td></tr><tr></tr><tr><td><div style="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; LINE-HEIGHT: 0px"></div></td></tr><tr><td>&nbsp;</td></tr></table></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong></strong>&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>BOSCH INTERNATIONAL LLC<br></strong>Notes to the Financial Statements</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><strong><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt times new roman" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="top" width="45"><strong>1. </strong></td><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>Nature of Operations and Going Concern</strong></p></td></tr></table></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"></strong>&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 45px">Bosch International LLC (the "Company") was incorporated in the State of California on May 7, 2015. The Company's principal business is the purchase and sale of light sheets which are used for the film and production industry. </p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 45px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 45px">These financial statements have been prepared on a going concern basis, which implies the Company will continue to realize its assets and discharge its liabilities in the normal course of business. The Company has not generated significant revenues since inception. The continuation of the Company as a going concern is dependent upon the continued financial support from its shareholders, the ability of the Company to obtain necessary equity financing to continue operations, and the attainment of profitable operations from the sale of light sheets. At May 31, 2015, the Company has not recorded any revenues, and has incurred a net loss of $12. These factors raise substantial doubt regarding the Company's ability to continue as a going concern. These financial statements do not include any adjustments for the recoverability and classification of recorded asset amounts and classification of liabilities that might be necessary should the Company be unable to continue as a going concern. </p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="e7da5f8d-d572-4323-aeb0-e9b497a49ac2" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN: auto" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="4%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong><font size="2">2. </font><font size="2"></font></strong></p></td><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong><font size="2">Summary of Significant Accounting Policies</font><font size="2"></font></strong></p></td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="3045d2fd-9252-4a8c-b410-840cf6f2d3a3" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN: auto" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="4%"></td><td valign="top" width="4%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">a) </p></td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Basis of Presentation</p></td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">These financial statements and related notes are presented in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States, and are expressed in U.S. dollars. The Company's fiscal year end is May 31. </p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="7121d11a-4048-4cfa-a1b5-753751b763f3" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN: auto" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="4%"></td><td valign="top" width="4%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">b) </p></td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Use of Estimates</p></td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">The preparation of financial statements in conformity with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting period. The Company bases its estimates and assumptions on current facts, historical experience and various other factors that it believes to be reasonable under the circumstances, the results of which form the basis for making judgments about the carrying values of assets and liabilities and the accrual of costs and expenses that are not readily apparent from other sources. The actual results experienced by the Company may differ materially and adversely from the Company's estimates. To the extent there are material differences between the estimates and the actual results, future results of operations will be affected.</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="ca00c794-81cd-4cb1-bb10-1b45028cc294" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN: auto" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="4%"></td><td valign="top" width="4%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">c) </p></td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Cash and Cash Equivalents</p></td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">The Company considers all highly liquid instruments with maturity of three months or less at the time of issuance to be cash equivalents.</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="3b6fd9f4-be22-4f08-9516-680cd805b74c" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN: auto" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="4%"></td><td valign="top" width="4%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">d) </p></td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Financial Instruments</p></td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">Pursuant to ASC 820, Fair Value Measurements and Disclosures, an entity is required to maximize the use of observable inputs and minimize the use of unobservable inputs when measuring fair value. ASC 820 establishes a fair value hierarchy based on the level of independent, objective evidence surrounding the inputs used to measure fair value. A financial instrument's categorization within the fair value hierarchy is based upon the lowest level of input that is significant to the fair value measurement. ASC 820 prioritizes the inputs into three levels that may be used to measure fair value:</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px"><em>Level 1</em></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">Level 1 applies to assets or liabilities for which there are quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities.</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="pagebreakd2a01e38-5c0a-456a-a61b-4eeb7c0909a3" class="pagebreak" style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0">    <tr><td class="hpbhr">&nbsp;</td></tr><tr><td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center">F-6</td></tr><tr></tr><tr><td><div style="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; LINE-HEIGHT: 0px"></div></td></tr><tr><td>&nbsp;</td></tr></table></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong><font size="2">BOSCH INTERNATIONAL LLC</font></strong><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Notes to the Financial Statements</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="bec2773b-1b95-49d1-9418-fd1dc9965f96" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN: auto" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="4%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong><font size="2">2. </font><font size="2"></font></strong></p></td><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong><font size="2">Summary of Significant Accounting Policies </font><font size="2">(continued)</font></strong></p></td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="41723892-fb89-4073-b5c1-b7ab6d38ed91" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN: auto" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="4%"></td><td valign="top" width="4%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">d) </p></td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Financial Instruments (continued)</p></td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px"><em>Level 2</em></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">Level 2 applies to assets or liabilities for which there are inputs other than quoted prices that are observable for the asset or liability such as quoted prices for similar assets or liabilities in active markets; quoted prices for identical assets or liabilities in markets with insufficient volume or infrequent transactions (less active markets); or model-derived valuations in which significant inputs are observable or can be derived principally from, or corroborated by, observable market data.</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px"><em>Level 3</em></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">Level 3 applies to assets or liabilities for which there are unobservable inputs to the valuation methodology that are significant to the measurement of the fair value of the assets or liabilities.</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">The Company's financial instruments consist principally of cash, amounts due to related parties, and notes payable. Pursuant to ASC 820, the fair value of our cash is determined based on "Level 1" inputs, which consist of quoted prices in active markets for identical assets. We believe that the recorded values of all of our other financial instruments approximate their current fair values because of their nature and respective maturity dates or durations. </p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="619adfbf-bf79-494b-a840-8f32494a09c7" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN: auto" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="4%"></td><td valign="top" width="4%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">e) </p></td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Comprehensive Income</p></td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">ASC 220, Comprehensive Income, establishes standards for the reporting and display of comprehensive loss and its components in the financial statements. As at March 31, 2011 and 2010, the Company has no items that represent a comprehensive loss and, therefore, has not included a schedule of comprehensive loss in the financial statements.</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="a41f3e12-23c9-441b-a21d-b8db55d37085" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN: auto" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="4%"></td><td valign="top" width="4%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">f) </p></td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Stock-based Compensation</p></td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">The Company records stock-based compensation in accordance with ASC 718, Compensation - Stock Compensation using the fair value method. All transactions in which goods or services are the consideration received for the issuance of equity instruments are accounted for based on the fair value of the consideration received or the fair value of the equity instrument issued, whichever is more reliably measurable. Equity instruments issued to employees and the cost of the services received as consideration are measured and recognized based on the fair value of the equity instruments issued.</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="ed49657d-4e9a-4467-a7e2-6a395376238d" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN: auto" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="4%"></td><td valign="top" width="4%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">g) </p></td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Income Taxes</p></td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">The Company is a disregarded entity for federal income tax purposes, and therefore has no federal income tax expense. However, the Company is subject to income taxes in some of the jurisdictions in which it conducts business, and therefore reports income taxes paid to these jurisdictions. Management believes they have not taken any tax positions that would adversely impact the Company's financial position. Penalties and interest associated with the Company's tax positions are classified as operating expenses. There were no interest or penalties for the year ended May 31, 2015.</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="pagebreak54a03736-f7cf-4cbd-9b69-b76043c49189" class="pagebreak" style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0">    <tr><td class="hpbhr">&nbsp;</td></tr><tr><td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center">F-7</td></tr><tr></tr><tr><td><div style="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; LINE-HEIGHT: 0px"></div></td></tr><tr><td>&nbsp;</td></tr></table></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong><font size="2">BOSCH INTERNATIONAL LLC</font></strong><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Notes to the Financial Statements</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="183207eb-7e31-4dda-947f-6ef7e41848f6" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN: auto" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="4%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong><font size="2">2. </font><font size="2"></font></strong></p></td><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong><font size="2">Summary of Significant Accounting Policies </font><font size="2">(continued)</font></strong></p></td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="280f85f3-abc2-471b-83c8-335cebd4f533" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN: auto" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="4%"></td><td valign="top" width="4%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">h) </p></td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Revenue Recognition</p></td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">The Company recognizes and accounts for revenue of the sale of light sheets in accordance with ASC 605, Revenue Recognition. Revenue is recognized when persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists, delivery has occurred, the amount is fixed and determinable, risk of ownership has passed to the customer, and collection is reasonably assured. </p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="10168a6a-4990-45b8-87b6-61efcba28f8c" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN: auto" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="4%"></td><td valign="top" width="4%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">i) </p></td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Inventory</p></td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">Inventory is comprised of light sheets and is recorded at the lower of cost or net realizable value on a first-in first-out basis. The Company establishes inventory reserves for estimated obsolete or unsaleable inventory equal to the difference between the cost of inventory and the estimated realizable value based upon assumptions about future and market conditions.</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="51765c8d-af8a-4dc9-8390-a213deb92756" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN: auto" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="4%"></td><td valign="top" width="4%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">j) </p></td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Concentrations</p></td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">In November 2015, the Company entered into two distribution license rights agreements with an entity in which the managing member owns a minority interest, where the Company obtained exclusive and non-exclusive license rights related to the distribution of light sheets in Canada and the United States. The license provides the Company's sole supplier of light sheets to be distributed in the United States for movie theatres and cinema companies, as well as select companies in the automotive industry. </p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="20208429-b54f-49df-9c74-81cdbb07932b" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN: auto" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="4%"></td><td valign="top" width="4%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">k) </p></td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Recent Accounting Pronouncements</p></td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">The Company has implemented all new accounting pronouncements that are in effect. These pronouncements did not have any material impact on the financial statements unless otherwise disclosed, and the Company does not believe that there are any other new accounting pronouncements that have been issued that might have a material impact on its financial position or results of operations.</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="1bd4a3e1-e3d1-4d0d-8e17-eaa5484adb53" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN: auto" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="4%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong><font size="2">3. </font><font size="2"></font></strong></p></td><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong><font size="2">Prepaid Expenses and Deposits</font><font size="2"></font></strong></p></td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 45px">As at May 31, 2015, the Company prepaid $65,005 for the purchase of light sheets for future sales. </p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="pagebreak967683b2-9926-47ba-aba5-ed18114880fd" class="pagebreak" style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0">    <tr><td class="hpbhr">&nbsp;</td></tr><tr><td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center">F-8</td></tr><tr></tr><tr><td><div style="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; LINE-HEIGHT: 0px"></div></td></tr><tr><td>&nbsp;</td></tr></table></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;<strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong><font size="2">BOSCH INTERNATIONAL LLC</font></strong><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Notes to the Financial Statements</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="be5677da-0e87-4e33-82b1-ffa8bbd256c8" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN: auto" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="4%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong><font size="2">4. </font><font size="2"></font></strong></p></td><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong><font size="2">Loan Payable</font><font size="2"></font></strong></p></td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 45px">On May 26, 2015, the Company entered into an agreement whereby it sold future receivables in exchange for $250,000. Per the terms of the agreement, the Company would repay the $250,000 plus 10% of the principal balance, for a total repayment of $275,000. As of May 31, 2015, the Company had received $75,000 pursuant to this agreement.</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="baf2dc7d-1418-4d59-8305-14b59b077079" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN: auto" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="4%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong><font size="2">5. </font><font size="2"></font></strong></p></td><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong><font size="2">Member Interests</font><font size="2"></font></strong></p></td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 45px">On May 8, 2015, the Company issued 100 member interests to the managing member of the Company for proceeds of $40. </p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="e99c2aad-f9d7-49a8-974d-a4f3989af28f" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN: auto" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="4%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong><font size="2">6. </font><font size="2"></font></strong></p></td><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong><font size="2">Related Party Transactions</font><font size="2"></font></strong></p></td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 45px">As at May 31, 2015, the Company owes $30,000 to the President and Director of the Company for loans made to the Company. The amount owing is unsecured, non-interest bearing, and due on demand. Also, as disclosed above, the Company entered into two distribution license rights agreements with an entity in which the managing member owns a minority interest. </p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="c05eaeb4-efc4-4e52-a86e-6de9129a33f3" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN: auto" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="4%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong><font size="2">7. </font><font size="2"></font></strong></p></td><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong><font size="2">Subsequent Events</font><font size="2"></font></strong></p></td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="61598532-26e9-4f6f-9b92-c971aca65381" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN: auto" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="4%"></td><td valign="top" width="4%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">a) </p></td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">On June 10, 2015, the Company received $175,000 as part of the loan payable as noted in Note 4.</p></td></tr><tr height="15"><td valign="top"></td><td valign="top"></td><td valign="top"></td></tr><tr height="15"><td valign="top"></td><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">b) </p></td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">On October 20, 2015, the Company entered into a share exchange agreement with XLI Technologies Inc. (formerly Mineria y Exploraciones Olympia, Inc.) ("XLI"), a publicly-traded company incorporated in the State of Nevada. In accordance with the agreement, XLI acquired 100% of the members' equity of the Company in exchange for 25,000,000 restricted common shares of XLI.</p></td></tr><tr height="15"><td></td><td></td><td></td></tr><tr height="15"><td></td><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">c)</p></td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">On September 8, 2015, the Company entered into an investment acquisition agreement with a third party whereby the Company agreed to issue 1% of its total Member Interests outstanding for $50,000. This agreement also specified that this third party would get a return of 10% of its equity position, to be paid quarterly (at the end of each calendar quarter) from future gross revenues of the Company. The Company is currently in negotiations with this third party to restructure this agreement. As of January 20, 2016, no amounts have been paid to this third party pursuant to this agreement.</p></td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>&nbsp;</strong><strong>   <p style="MARGIN: 0px"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="pagebreak73c8ae1f-ee48-49fd-bcb0-ff8bff58662c" class="pagebreak" style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0">    <tr><td class="hpbhr">&nbsp;</td></tr><tr><td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center">F-9</td></tr><tr></tr><tr><td><div style="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; LINE-HEIGHT: 0px"></div></td></tr><tr><td>&nbsp;</td></tr></table></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px" align="center"></strong><b><font size="2"></font></b>&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px" align="center"><b><font INC.</font></b></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px" align="center"><b><font size="2">TABLE OF CONTENTS</font></b></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px" align="center"><b><font size="2">FOR THE QUARTER ENDED NOVEMBER 30, 2015</font></b><font size="2"></font></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><b><font size="2">&nbsp;   <p style="MARGIN: 0px"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><b><font size="2">XLI TECHNOLOGIES, 0px">&nbsp;</p><table id="pagebreakc10228f0-6e69-4fc5-803a-eeb4ffd7c6fc" class="pagebreak" style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0">    <tr><td class="hpbhr">&nbsp;</td></tr><tr><td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center">F-10</td></tr><tr></tr><tr><td><div style="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; LINE-HEIGHT: 0px"></div></td></tr><tr><td>&nbsp;</td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><b><font size="2">XLI TECHNOLOGIES, INC.</font></b></p></font></b><p style="MARGIN: 0px">(formerly Mineria Y Exploraciones Olympia, Inc.)</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Condensed Consolidated Balance Sheets</p><b><font size="2"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="977a68c1-bfe6-41e3-ac51-38a64377982e" style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN: auto; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="bottom"><p style="MARGIN: 0px" align="right"><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p></td><td valign="bottom"><p style="MARGIN: 0px" align="right"><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p></td><td id="hdcell" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1px solid" valign="bottom" colspan="2" align="center"><p style="MARGIN: 0px" align="center"><strong>November 30,</strong></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px" align="center"><strong>2015</strong></p></td><td valign="bottom"><p style="MARGIN: 0px" align="center"><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p></td><td valign="bottom"><p style="MARGIN: 0px" align="center"><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p></td><td id="hdcell" valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td></tr><tr bgcolor="#ffffff"><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Supplemental disclosures:</p></td><td valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td><td valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td><td id="ffcell" valign="bottom" width="9%" align="right"><p style="MARGIN: valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td><td valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td><td id="ffcell" valign="bottom" width="9%" TEXT-INDENT: 15px">Income taxes paid</p></td><td valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td><td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1px solid" valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td><td id="ffcell" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1px solid" valign="bottom" width="9%" align="right">&#8211;</td><td style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 1px" valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td></tr><tr bgcolor="#cceeff"><td>&nbsp;</td><td valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td><td valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td><td id="ffcell" valign="bottom" width="9%" align="right"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td><td valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td></tr><tr bgcolor="#ffffff"><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Noncash Investing and financing activities</p></td><td valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td><td valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td><td id="ffcell" valign="bottom" width="9%" align="right"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td><td valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td></tr><tr bgcolor="#cceeff"><td>&nbsp;</td><td valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td><td valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td><td id="ffcell" valign="bottom" width="9%" align="right"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td><td valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td></tr><tr bgcolor="#ffffff"><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Net liabilities assumed in share exchange agreement</p></td><td valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td><td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 3px double" valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td><td id="ffcell" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 3px double" valign="bottom" width="9%" align="right">15,698</td><td style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 3px" valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></font></b><p style="MARGIN: 0px" align="center">(The accompanying notes are an integral part of these condensed consolidated financial statements)</p><b><font size="2"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><table id="pagebreak02950b76-6c02-437d-bb06-0aa232c7892e" class="pagebreak" style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0">    <tr><td class="hpbhr">&nbsp;</td></tr><tr><td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center">F-13</td></tr><tr></tr><tr><td><div style="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; LINE-HEIGHT: 0px"></div></td></tr><tr><td>&nbsp;</td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><b><font size="2">XLI TECHNOLOGIES, INC.</font></b></p></font></b><p style="MARGIN: 0px">(formerly Mineria Y Exploraciones Olympia, Inc.)</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Notes to the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">(unaudited)</p><b><font size="2"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><b><font size="2"><table style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt times new roman" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="top" width="45"><strong>1. </strong></td><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>Nature of Operations and Continuance of Business</strong></p></td></tr></table></font></b>&nbsp;</p></font></b><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 45px">XLI Technologies, Inc. (formerly Mineria Y Exploraciones Olympia, Inc.) (the "Company") was incorporated under the laws of the State of Nevada on August 22, 2012 for the purpose of acquiring and developing mineral properties. On October 20, 2015, the Company entered into a share exchange agreement with Bosch International, LLC ("Bosch LLC"), a company incorporated in the State of Nevada on May 7, 2015 for the purpose of the purchase and sale of light sheets which are used in the film and production industry. As part of the share exchange agreement, the Company acquired 100% of the members' interest of Bosch LLC in exchange for 25,000,000 restricted common shares of the Company. As part of the acquisition, the members of Bosch acquired 50,000,000 common shares of the Company in a private transaction with the former CEO and Director of the Company, and one of the members of Bosch became the sole officer and director of the Company. As a result, the members of Bosch LLC held 75,000,000 common shares of the 100,000,000 common shares of the Company, and the acquisition was treated as a reverse merger where by Bosch LLC is considered the accounting acquirer. </p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 45px">These condensed consolidated financial statements have been prepared on a going concern basis, which implies the Company will continue to realize its assets and discharge its liabilities in the normal course of business. The continuation of the Company as a going concern is dependent upon the continued financial support from its shareholders, the ability of the Company to obtain necessary equity financing to continue operations, and the attainment of profitable operations from the sale of light sheets. At November 30, 2015, the Company has recorded minimal revenues of $10,000, has a working capital deficit of $193,350, and an accumulated deficit of $227,692. These factors raise substantial doubt regarding the Company's ability to continue as a going concern. These condensed consolidated financial statements do not include any adjustments to the recoverability and classification of recorded asset amounts and classification of liabilities that might be necessary should the Company be unable to continue as a going concern.<b><font size="2">   <p style="MARGIN: 0px"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt times new roman" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="top" width="45"><strong>2. </strong></td><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>Summary of Significant Accounting Policies</strong></p></td></tr></table>&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt times new roman; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top" width="45">a) </td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Basis of Presentation</p></td></tr></table>&nbsp;</p></font></b><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">These condensed consolidated financial statements and related notes are presented in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States, and are expressed in U.S. dollars. The Company's fiscal year end is May 31. </p><b><font size="2"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt times new roman; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top" width="45">b) </td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Use of Estimates</p></td></tr></table>&nbsp;</p></font></b><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">The preparation of financial statements in conformity with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting period. The Company regularly evaluates estimates and assumptions related to the deferred income tax asset valuation allowances. The Company bases its estimates and assumptions on current facts, historical experience and various other factors that it believes to be reasonable under the circumstances, the results of which form the basis for making judgments about the carrying values of assets and liabilities and the accrual of costs and expenses that are not readily apparent from other sources. The actual results experienced by the Company may differ materially and adversely from the Company's estimates. To the extent there are material differences between the estimates and the actual results, future results of operations will be affected.</p><b><font size="2"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="pagebreakdecf2490-aef1-4a3e-a0ca-03cd92a9fb88" class="pagebreak" style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0">    <tr><td class="hpbhr">&nbsp;</td></tr><tr><td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center">F-14</td></tr><tr></tr><tr><td><div style="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; LINE-HEIGHT: 0px"></div></td></tr><tr><td>&nbsp;</td></tr></table></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><font size="2">XLI TECHNOLOGIES, INC.</font></p></font></b><p style="MARGIN: 0px">(formerly Mineria Y Exploraciones Olympia, Inc.)</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Notes to the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">(unaudited)</p><b><font size="2"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><font size="2"><br></font></p></font></b><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt times new roman" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="top" width="45"><strong>2. </strong></td><b><font size="2"><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>Summary of Significant Accounting Policies (continued)</strong></p></td></font></b></tr></table>&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="de9f706c-76ee-4755-8b9f-84a935b5bb37" style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt times new roman; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top" width="45">c) </td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Interim Condensed Financial Statements</p></td></tr></table>&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">These interim condensed consolidated financial statements have been prepared on the same basis as the annual financial statements and in the opinion of management, reflect all adjustments, which include only normal recurring adjustments, necessary to present fairly the Company's financial position, results of operations and cash flows for the periods shown. The results of operations for such periods are not necessarily indicative of the results expected for a full year or for any future period.</p><b><font size="2"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt times new roman; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top" width="45">d) </td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Cash and Cash Equivalents</p></td></tr></table>&nbsp;</p></font></b><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">The Company considers all highly liquid instruments with maturity of three months or less at the time of issuance to be cash equivalents.</p><b><font size="2"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt times new roman; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top" width="45">e) </td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Financial Instruments</p></td></tr></table>&nbsp;</p></font></b><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">Pursuant to ASC 820, Fair Value Measurements and Disclosures, an entity is required to maximize the use of observable inputs and minimize the use of unobservable inputs when measuring fair value. ASC 820 establishes a fair value hierarchy based on the level of independent, objective evidence surrounding the inputs used to measure fair value. A financial instrument's categorization within the fair value hierarchy is based upon the lowest level of input that is significant to the fair value measurement. ASC 820 prioritizes the inputs into three levels that may be used to measure fair value:</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px"><em>Level 1</em></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">Level 1 applies to assets or liabilities for which there are quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities.</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px"><em>Level 2</em></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">Level 2 applies to assets or liabilities for which there are inputs other than quoted prices that are observable for the asset or liability such as quoted prices for similar assets or liabilities in active markets; quoted prices for identical assets or liabilities in markets with insufficient volume or infrequent transactions (less active markets); or model-derived valuations in which significant inputs are observable or can be derived principally from, or corroborated by, observable market data.</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px"><em>Level 3</em></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">Level 3 applies to assets or liabilities for which there are unobservable inputs to the valuation methodology that are significant to the measurement of the fair value of the assets or liabilities.</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">The Company's financial instruments consist principally of cash, inventory, accounts payable and accrued liabilities, amounts due to related parties, and loans payable. Pursuant to ASC 820, the fair value of our cash is determined based on "Level 1" inputs, which consist of quoted prices in active markets for identical assets. We believe that the recorded values of all of our other financial instruments approximate their current fair values because of their nature and respective maturity dates or durations. </p><b><font size="2"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt times new roman; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top" width="45">f) </td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Comprehensive Income</p></td></tr></table>&nbsp;</p></font></b><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">ASC 220, Comprehensive Income, establishes standards for the reporting and display of comprehensive loss and its components in the financial statements. As at November 30 and May 31, 2015, the Company has no items that represent a comprehensive loss and, therefore, has not included a schedule of comprehensive loss in the financial statements.</p><b><font size="2"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><table id="pagebreak0fad7a05-8f09-435c-9bd9-5592e8d654b8" class="pagebreak" style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0">    <tr><td class="hpbhr">&nbsp;</td></tr><tr><td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center">F-15</td></tr><tr></tr><tr><td><div style="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; LINE-HEIGHT: 0px"></div></td></tr><tr><td>&nbsp;</td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><b><font size="2">XLI TECHNOLOGIES, INC.</font></b></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">(formerly Mineria Y Exploraciones Olympia, Inc.)</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Notes to the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">(unaudited)</p>&nbsp;   <p style="MARGIN: 0px"><b><table style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt times new roman" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="top" width="45"><strong>2. </strong></td><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>Summary of Significant Accounting Policies (continued)</strong></p></td></tr></table></b>&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt times new roman; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top" width="45">g) </td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Revenue Recognition</p></td></tr></table>&nbsp;</p></font></b><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">The Company recognizes and accounts for revenue of the sale of light sheets in accordance with ASC 605, Revenue Recognition. Revenue is recognized when persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists, delivery has occurred, the amount is fixed and determinable, risk of ownership has passed to the customer, and collection is reasonably assured. </p><b><font size="2"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt times new roman; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top" width="45">h) </td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Inventory</p></td></tr></table>&nbsp;</p></font></b><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">Inventory is comprised of light sheets and is recorded at the lower of cost or net realizable value on a first-in first-out basis. The Company establishes inventory reserves for estimated obsolete or unsaleable inventory equal to the difference between the cost of inventory and the estimated realizable value based upon assumptions about future and market conditions.</p><b><font size="2"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt times new roman; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top" width="45">i) </td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Concentrations</p></td></tr></table>&nbsp;</p></font></b><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">In November 2015, the Company entered into two distribution license rights agreements with an entity in which the managing member owns a minority interest, where the Company obtained exclusive and non-exclusive license rights related to the distribution of light sheets in Canada and the United States. The license provides the Company's sole supplier of light sheets to be distributed in the United States for movie theatres and cinema companies, as well as select companies in the automotive industry. </p><b><font size="2"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt times new roman; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top" width="45">j) </td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Stock-based Compensation</p></td></tr></table>&nbsp;</p></font></b><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">The Company records stock-based compensation in accordance with ASC 718, Compensation &#8211; Stock Compensation using the fair value method. All transactions in which goods or services are the consideration received for the issuance of equity instruments are accounted for based on the fair value of the consideration received or the fair value of the equity instrument issued, whichever is more reliably measurable. Equity instruments issued to employees and the cost of the services received as consideration are measured and recognized based on the fair value of the equity instruments issued.</p><b><font size="2"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt times new roman; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top" width="45">k) </td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Recent Accounting Pronouncements</p></td></tr></table>&nbsp;</p></font></b><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 90px">The Company has implemented all new accounting pronouncements that are in effect. These pronouncements did not have any material impact on the financial statements unless otherwise disclosed, and the Company does not believe that there are any other new accounting pronouncements that have been issued that might have a material impact on its financial position or results of operations.</p><b><font size="2"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><b><table style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt times new roman" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="top" width="45"><strong>3. </strong></td><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>Inventory</strong></p></td></tr></table></b>&nbsp;</p></font></b><p style="MARGIN: 0px 0px 0px 45px">As at November 30, 2015, the Company had acquired inventory with a cost of $167,323 (May 31, 2015 - $0). This inventory is classified as finished goods as it is ready to sell to third parties. </p><b><font size="2"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><b><table style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt times new roman" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="top" width="45"><strong>4. </strong></td><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>Loan Payable</strong></p></td></tr></table></b>&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt times new roman; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top" width="45">a) </td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">On May 26, 2015, the Company entered into an agreement whereby it sold future receivables in exchange for $250,000. Per the terms of the agreement, the Company would repay the $250,000 plus 10% of the principal balance, for a total repayment of $275,000. The amounts are to be repaid from future sales. As of November 30, 2015, the Company had received $250,000 (May 31, 2015 - $75,000) pursuant to this agreement.</p></td></tr><tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top"></td></tr><tr><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top" width="45">b) </td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">As of November 30, 2015, the Company owed $126,152 (May 31, 2015 - $nil) to a non-related company for loans. The amounts owing are unsecured, bear interest at 10% per annum, and are due on demand. At November 30, 2015, accrued interest of $5,252 (May 31, 2015 - $nil) is owing on the loans payable.</p></td></tr></table>&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="pagebreak5b1c29e9-6580-46e7-97e7-3d7427b2a19d" class="pagebreak" style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0">    <tr><td class="hpbhr">&nbsp;</td></tr><tr><td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center">F-16</td></tr><tr></tr><tr><td><div style="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; LINE-HEIGHT: 0px"></div></td></tr><tr><td>&nbsp;</td></tr></table></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><font size="2"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><font size="2"><strong>XLI TECHNOLOGIES, INC.</strong></font></p></font></font></b><p style="MARGIN: 0px">(formerly Mineria Y Exploraciones Olympia, Inc.)</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Notes to the Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">(unaudited)<b><font size="2"><font size="2"><strong><br>&nbsp;</strong>   <p style="MARGIN: 0px"></font><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><b><table style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt times new roman" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="top" width="45"><strong>5. </strong></td><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>Stockholders' Equity</strong></p></td></tr></table></b>&nbsp;</p></font></b><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><em>Subscription payable</em></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Prior to the October 21, 2015 share exchange agreement, the Company received $50,000 for 1% of the Member interests of Bosch International LLC. As of January 20, 2016, no interests, or common shares, have been issued related to this investment agreement.</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><em>Common Stock</em></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Issued and outstanding: 100,000,000 common shares</p><b><font size="2"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt times new roman; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top" width="45">a) </td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px" align="justify">On May 8, 2015, the Company issued 100 member interests to the President and Director of the Company for proceeds of $40. On October 21, 2015, the Company completed a share exchange agreement whereby the 100 member interests of Bosch International LLC were converted into common shares of the Company at a rate of 250,000 common shares per member interest, resulting in the issuance of 25,000,000 common shares.</p></td></tr><tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top"></td></tr><tr><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top" width="45">b) </td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">On December 22, 2015, the Company's board of directors resolved to increase in the Company's authorized common shares to 700,000,000, from 550,000,000.</p></td></tr></table>&nbsp;</p></font></b><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><em>Preferred Stock</em></p><b><font size="2"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></font></b><p style="MARGIN: 0px">On December 22, 2015, the Company's board of directors resolved to authorize 100,000,000 shares of preferred stock, with a par value of $.001. </p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt times new roman" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="top" width="45"><strong>6. </strong></td><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>Related Party Transactions</strong></p></td></tr></table><b><font size="2">&nbsp;   <p style="MARGIN: 0px"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt times new roman; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top" width="45">a) </td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">During the period ended November 30, 2015, the Company paid back a $30,000 loan to its CEO.</p></td></tr><tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top"></td></tr><tr><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top" width="45">b) </td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px">During the three months ended November 30, 2015, the CEO paid accounts payable on behalf of the Company, in the amount of $15,910 (2015 - $nil). Amounts owed to the CEO are unsecured, non-interest bearing, and due on demand.</p></td></tr></table></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><b><table style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt times new roman" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="top" width="45"><strong>7. </strong></td><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><strong>Subsequent Events</strong></p></td></tr></table></b>&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt times new roman; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0">    <tr><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top" width="45">a) </td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px" align="justify">On December 1, 2015, the Company issued 5,500,000 common shares to a non-related party with respect to a sponsorship agreement.</p></td></tr><tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top"></td></tr><tr><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top" width="45">b) </td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px" align="justify">On December 3, 2015, the Company entered into a convertible promissory note agreement with a non-related party for proceeds of $250,000. Under the terms of the convertible promissory note, the amount owing is unsecured, bears interest at 12% per annum, and is due on September 3, 2016. The note is convertible into common shares of the Company at the lower of: (i) a 40% discount to the lowest trading price during the previous twenty trading days to the date of conversion; or (ii) a 40% discount to the lowest trading price during the previous twenty trading days before the date that the convertible promissory note was executed. As part of the convertible promissory note, the Company paid a finder's fee of $25,000.</p></td></tr><tr height="15"><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top"></td></tr><tr><td valign="top" width="45"></td><td valign="top" width="45">c) </td><td><p style="MARGIN: 0px" align="justify">On December 28, 2015, the Company entered into a loan agreement with a non-related party for proceeds of $10,000. The amount owing is unsecured, bears interest at 10% per annum, and is due on demand.</p></td></tr></table>&nbsp;</p><table id="pagebreak89137b53-edf9-4881-9e5f-a006a7c70fc5" class="pagebreak" style="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; font-size-adjust: none; font-stretch: normal" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0">    <tr><td class="hpbhr">&nbsp;</td></tr><tr><td style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1px solid; TEXT-ALIGN: center">F-17</td></tr><tr></tr><tr><td><div style="WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; LINE-HEIGHT: 0px"></div></td></tr><tr><td>&nbsp;</td></tr></table><p style="MARGIN: 0px"></font></b>&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px" align="center"><b><font size="2">PART II &#8211; INFORMATION NOT REQUIRED IN PROSPECTUS</font></b><font size="2"></font></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><b><font size="2">ITEM 13. OTHER EXPENSES OF ISSUANCE AND DISTRIBUTION.</font></b><font size="2"></font></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px; TEXT-INDENT: 45px"><font size="2">The following table sets forth estimated expenses expected to be incurred in connection with the issuance and distribution of the securities being registered. All such expenses will be paid by us.<b></b></font></p><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p><p style="MARGIN: 0px"><table id="0e52caa2-02cb-4493-bd97-84facf306c46" style="WIDTH: 70%; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; FONT: 10pt TIMES NEW ROMAN; MARGIN: auto" cellspacing="0" cols="5" cellpadding="0" width="70%" align="center" border="0">    <tr bgcolor="#cceeff"><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Securities and Exchange Commission Registration Fee</p></td><td valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td><td valign="bottom" width="1%">$</td><td id="ffcell" valign="bottom" width="9%" align="right"><font size="2">356.53</font></td><td valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td></tr><tr bgcolor="#ffffff"><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Audit Fees and Expenses</p></td><td valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td><td valign="bottom" width="1%">$</td><td id="ffcell" valign="bottom" width="9%" align="right">15,000.00</td><td valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td></tr><tr bgcolor="#cceeff"><td valign="top"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">Legal Fees and Expenses </p></td><td valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN: 0px">&nbsp;</p></td><td valign="bottom" width="1%">$</td><td id="ffcell" valign="bottom" width="9%" align="right">35,000.00</td><td valign="bottom" width="1%"><p style="MARGIN:
